structure.unit: Chapter 19 RESPONSIBLE PROPERTY OWNER AND MERCHANT ACT

law.catch_line: Maintenance of Informational or Directional Signs.

text.section:
Sec. 19-15.7. Maintenance of Informational or Directional Signs.
Informational or directional signs shall be maintained in a safe and visible manner and free of graffiti. It shall be unlawful to maintain or allow to be maintained missing or damaged signs required to designate disabled, bicycle area, baby stroller or other signage required by County Code, including the required striping and pavement markings for disabled parking spaces, as well as access ramps and access paths for wheelchair traffic, as required under Article II, of the Code of Miami-Dade County and Section 553.5041(6) of the Florida Statutes.
